description: After applying the security update (KB5044273) for Windows 10 versions 22H2 and 21H2 and Windows Server 2019, users may notice inaccessible resources or services, indicating that certain functionalities have been disrupted due to the elevation of privilege vulnerability addressed by this update. The observable behavior can manifest as users experiencing issues with accessing applications, files, or specific functionalities in Windows, potentially leading to confusion or frustration. Administrators might also receive reports of unexpected unavailability of services that previously functioned correctly. This disruption emphasizes the importance of timely patching to maintain system integrity, as well as informing users to expect some adjustments following such critical updates. The affected builds include Windows 10 version 22H2 for both x64 and 32-bit systems and Windows 10 version 21H2 for both x64 and 32-bit systems.
